Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Efficacy of Prophylactic Antibiotics in Clean and Clean-Contaminated Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation was conducted at the participant level, with allocation concealment ensured.

Participants.evidence: The study setting included various international locations, and eligibility criteria focused on clean and clean-contaminated surgeries.

Intervention.evidence: comparing preoperative and postoperative prophylactic antibiotic use against placebo in clean and clean-contaminated surgeries.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of surgical site infections (SSIs), measured over the postoperative period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted at the participant level, with allocation concealment ensured.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors, patients, and clinicians.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The pooled odds ratio (OR) for SSIs with antibiotic prophylaxis versus placebo was 0.60 (95% CI: 0.53â€“0.68).

Funding.evidence: Funding: No specific funding was received.
